alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 04 at 2:48PM MDT until April 06 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...West to southwest winds 50 to 60 MPH with frequent gusts to 85 MPH expected. Occasional gusts 90 to 100 MPH are possible. Snow and blowing snow will also occur over the Snowy Range with whiteout conditions possible at times. * WHERE...Snowy Range and adjacent foothills including Centennial, Arlington, and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. There will be an extreme risk for vehicle blow overs! Tree damage is also possible near the Snowy Range. Mountain recreation may be extremely dangerous to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.

area.areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range
